alert.note: Alert for Clark; Ford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 5:56PM CDT until June 15 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN FORD AND CLARK COUNTIES... At 555 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Ft. Dodge to 10 miles northwest of Ashland to near Englewood, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Bucklin, Minneola, Ford, Bloom, Englewood, Sitka, Clark State Lake, Kingsdown and Acres. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
